text: Bouteille de 600 ml. liquide jaune orangé trouble avec un joli col blanc. Puissant arôme de fleur, de citron et dépices. Goût de fruits, de noix et et de sucre. Elle est très douce pour une bière titrant 10% ABV.
Draft at Vices et Versa, Montreal. Pale gold, white head. Aroma of apple, peach, pear, Belgian yeast and spice. Taste follows nose with some lemon, cloves and booze. Great tripel.

10oz on tap at BarHop, Toronto. Pours an opage gold colour with a small lasting head. Aromas of peach, grapefruit, pine and honey. Taste matches the aroma with notes of banana. Not as hoppy as I expected. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Had a nice thick off-white had but that quickly settled to almost none and no lace. Aromas malty, spicy, and a hint metallic. Flavors like nose, sweet up front, then a bit tart, and only slightly bitter. Ok body with some alcoholic warmth in the finish.

On tap at Boswell and three bottles in the pass if I recall. Amber with a tall whit foam with big bubbles. Aroma is from Belgian-style triple malt and yeast, spicy. Same on the taste and sweet. Medium body and high carbonation. Long yeasty and spicy finish.

Nez: Malté, banane, épicé
Bouche: Maltée, miel, poire, banane, raisin, épicée, alcool
Une bière dune belle complexité

Quel bel hommage québécois aux triples dabbaye belges avec cette buteuse de la brasserie Le Trou du Diable. Les codes du genre sont scrupuleusement respectés, avec une bière tout en équilibre entre malt, houblon et alcool, et entre rondeur et puissance sur des arômes fruités et épicés. De couleur ambrée en verre (EBC de 30 environ), cette triple, limpide présente une multitude de très fines bulles et une mousse blanche dun centimètre dépaisseur. Le nez est splendide et dun équilibre splendieux. Céréales, miel, banane, coriandre et une pointe citronnée sassemblent avec en laissant sexprimer à la fois le malt et le houblon. A la dégustation, lattaque est fruitée et fraîche avec des arômes de pêche, poire et banane. Des notes poivrées permettent quant à elles de procurer un peu de peps et du relief à lensemble.La deuxième bouche soriente sur le malt et des arômes de miel, de pomme et de poire. Le sucre est très présent, donnant de la rondeur voire de lourdeur à cette triple, mais heureusement larrière bouche sur lamertume et les épices permettent de conférer un peu de légèreté. Lamertume devient plus franche en troisième bouche. Celle-ci dune intensité modérée est bien maîtrisée et sur une belle alliance avec lalcool. Les 10 % Abv se sentent peu, la cause à un sucre très présent. Le final sera dune longueur modérée. Lamertume y est cependant un peu plus saillante, sur des notes poivrées et des touches de genièvre. Un final un peu plus enlevé et long aurait été appréciable, mais lalcool et les arômes, un peu anesthésiés par le sucre, ne le permettent pas. Mais ces québécois ont de façon certaine des aïeux belges pour avoir donner à cette belle triple digne des Saint Feuillien ou Watou Triple.

La bouteille nous verse une bière blonde, avec un doigt de carbonatation et une petite effervescence. Au nez cest classique du style avec la levure belge, un peu de poivre, du sucre et vin blanc. En bouche, cest assez fin, avec une petite effervescence, une levure belge intéressante, mais pas trop englobante, pommes vertes. Bel équilibre.

This sample was brewed in 2012, so this rating is more reflective of its aging ability. The malt character remains prevalent, overpowering any remaining yeast characteristics. At this point; it no longer resembles a tripel.

Bottle from local beer store. This beer is exceptional! It has an exceptional complex taste. One of the best beer of its kind. Not always available, even in specialized stores. It may be brewed only for a certain period or for a limited quantity. A real pleasure to drink. At 10%, I may wish TDD to sell it in smaller bottles, or I may share it with friends.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange-yellow with lots of sediment floating around and a huge, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet, fruity aroma of apricot, grapes, yeast, caramel, bread and spice. Sweet, fruity flavour of peach, orange, caramel, yeast, bread, spice and white wine in a dry, bitter, warming finish. Medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle, 375mL. Home. A golden orange clear fizzy beer with a medium white head ; medium retention. Citrus, light biscuit, light caramel, roast, alcohol, light herb. Light sweet, light to medium dry bitter warming, light acid. Medium good body, light silky texture, average carbonation, dry warming finish. Overall, very good ! Nice tripel.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty weak oaky aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty oaky flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty weak oaky finish.

Bottle thanks to Youri! Pours hazy orange, medium beige creamy head, dissipates fairly quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is Brett out the wazoo, grass, basement aromas, honey and floral. Flavor is medium plus sweet, medium funky, loads of Brett and honey. Medium body, high carbonation. Just too damn sweet to be enjoyable.

Hazy amber color with storming activity. Slightly frothy 2 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with moderate legs. Flavors of citrus, coriander, apples, banana yeast, sweet grains, faint clove, floral and herbal spices. Bready with thick sugars, lots of spices, great sharpness. Slick smooth medium to full body with champagne like carbonation. Medium to strong finish, ending with a dry vinous citrus orange and estery feel. Overall very good quality craft. Very tasty and filling. The alcohol is incredibly well hidden. Nice intensity, good balance, super fresh. A little heavy on the spices.

On tap at Cirkus, Stavanger. Pours clear weak brown with a small head. Aroma of yeast, caramel, mild spicy. Taste is moderate sweet, caramel and red ripe fruits, creamy filling mouthfeel, long weak spicy finish.

600 mL bottle. Clear orange from the top of the bottle. Hazy in the middle. Smells of citrus, Belgian yeast, and a strong malt presence. Taste has a ton of malt as well. Almost no citrus here. Yeast lends banana and some spice. Heavy caramel. Dries out quickly. Medium heavy. Medium carbonation. Malty version of a tripel, which might be a generous descriptor.

Apparence : Dorée, reflet jaunes pâles, bon col blanc crémeux ayant une longue rétention, effervescence moyenne et modérément rapide, très belle dentelle. 
Nez : Levure belge, épices, légers agrumes et légèrement fruité du type pommes et poires, céréales fraîches. 
Goût : Levure dominante, phénols, malt céréalier et quelque peu mielleux, fruits moins présents quau nez. Finale où sentremêlent la levure et une touche damertume, celle-ci durant moins longtemps que la levure.
Sensation : Effervescence moyenne, dense, crémeuse, léger picotement présent partout en bouche, légère chaleur dalcool, finale de longueur moyenne. 
Bref : Goût intéressant avec une densité impressionnante pour une Triple. Par contre, ce nest pas extrêmement complexe ni intense. Les 10% ne se sentent pas et ne se goûtent pas non plus. Très levurée, sans être débalancée pour autant, elle na pas réellement de défaut, mais nest pas mémorable pour autant.

Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours clear golden with fizzy, white head. Fruity and bready aroma with grass, caramel and some yeast. Floral, bready taste with fruit, grass, caramel. Somewhat spicy. Light carbonation. Short, malty finish. Overall very nice.

Pours with middling bleach white head, plenty of carbonation, okay yellowish body. Smell of must and lemon, old books, vague lambic hints. Flavour is orange rind, gueuze, a squeeze of peach. Fruity for sure, sits well on the mouth but not especially so. Certainly a good beer, very sharp, would benefit from being paired with some artisanal cheese. Now wheres ma cheese....

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas Attention Passage De Brasseurs 160623. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Fruity bready aroma, caramel, grapes, yeasty, glue notes, floral, slightly spicy. Fruity yeasty flavor, grapes, citrus, caramel, spicy notes. Quite nice.

Bottle from NB Liquor. Cloudy medium amber with a large fluffy lingering white head that leaves a lot of tight lace.Nose of yeast, spice, floral hops, apricot, and light banana. Light sweet fruit with a light+tartness and an equal level of spice. mouth is medium- with prickly carbonation and a dry finish. Well balanced with the alcohol well integrated.

8/4/7+/3+/16

Bottle 375ml, a cloudy amber beer with medium head. Nose is on quince, ripped fruits, apples, orange and belgian yeast. Aroma is on the same, sugar, belgian yeast, alcohol, ripped fruits, orange. Nothing original or outstanding, nothing more to say.

From the 650 ml/ bottle with a bottling date of 10-12-14, so it has a little age. Orange amber pour under a modest tan head that fades some. Good clarity. The aroma has a notable spicy and orange fruity character with those toasted Belgian malts. The body is medium. The taste brings out a lovely fruity character with a touch of toasted malts and a slightly bitter finish. But there is a boozy burn for sure even after two years.
Pours a bright golden yellow color. Aromas of hops, fruit, and a little yeast. Has a light lemony taste, with some yeasty notes, and a good hop flavor.

Où, Quand, Comment : 

Bouteille, dégustée le 4/11/2015. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : dorée-ambrée. 
Apparence : légèrement voilée. 


Arôme :  
Levures fruitées (agrumes, pêche, notes de pommes) et épicées (poivre), léger de pain, léger de de houblon herbeux et floral. 


Goût :  
En entrée de bouche : Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes sucrées, pêches mûres, notes de pommes et de marmelade) et moyennement épicées (poivre). 
Un léger support de pain sucré et de malt pâle est présent avec une légère amertume dalcool et de houblon floral, herbeux et aux notes fruitées (zeste dagrumes). 


En bouche :  

Corps : moyen.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : très légèrement crémeuse.
Finale : moyenne et un peu sèche, composée dune légère amertume dalcool réchauffant et de houblon floral avec des notes de levures épicées.
Tttttttttrrrrrrrrrreeeeeeeeeeeerssssssssss bbbbbbbbooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn n n

Couleur un peu cuivrette pale, ambré. Très légère effervescence qui en fait une bière sans mousse. Nez un peu mielleux, épicé, sucre alcoolisé. En bouche, malté, cest tres doux de sucres et dépices. Lalcool se réchauffe avec la température ambiante!

Cloudy yellow orange hue with a swiftly vanishing white head. Minor effervescence. Delectable aroma with hints of banana, caramel, toast, vanilla, toffee, nutmeg, and peach. Brawny bodied with a syrup like texture. Super coalescence of flavours that directly mimics the aroma with added emphasis on banana, yeast, and sweet peach. Sweet, alcohol infused finish. Beautiful.

Cafe Sara, january 8th 2016. Clear golden body with a thick white head. Aroma of honey, banana and funk, taste is mild spicy with fresh fruits and wheat, grapes. Fizzy and whitewineish finish. Quite nice!

@ bartlebiers Tripel Tasting @ bierhandlung, FR, Jan.16; nose: deep, three-dimensional, like walking into an old bar with dark, pipe-tobacco impregnated wood; hints of sweet tobacco, even cedarwood, lighter, sweeter caramel malts, hints of honey. A great, complex Tripel.

66cl bottle bbJun2017 (2014 Mondial de la Bière 2014) at Biere mit Stil 1: Worldwide Tripel [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Freiburg JAN2016. - - A very subtly layered, cleanly-engineered New World tripel that packs a 60EBU fruit punch in between the apricot and apple honey tart layers of its body. - The overdosed hops almost kill the yeast-derived subtleties going on underneath the honeycoated layers of malt - yet the palate and tongue is happy to continue exploring. No abv wafts, some warmth. More sweet, rich and "reduced-down" bitter like the syrup resins of a TIPA or barley wine than phenolic and yeast-powered like a BE tripel. Most respectable foreign cover in the 15+ tripel series.

thanks alex bottle light amber cloudy medium head spicy medium malty note mediun bitterness light citric 
Leggero ambrato piuttosto torbida buona schiuma naso fruttato speziato buona maltatura ma non stucchevole amaro medio filo citrico

Faible côté arôme, mais belle donne dorée/cuivrée avec une mousse blanche compacte, mais pas très résistante. En bouche, très bon équilibre de lalcool, lamertume et le corps. Un produit qui se compare très bien aux dubbel belges.

Cloudy orange body white foamy head some lacing. Sweet yeast grain and vanilla cereal aroma. Really nice. A touch of acidity. Taste is sweet, some banana, peach, a touch of dryness. Smooth palate. Really nice tripel.

Bottle. Hazy golden amber pour with a white head. Aroma is citrus zest, bread and a bit of candy sweetness. Taste is fairly sweet, candy notes, mandarin orange, lemon zest, some Belgian yeast. Pretty nice tripel, but I'd prefer it more dry.
Una buona tripel, maltata, mielosa, fruttata e corposa. Buona struttura e gusto non banale, molto equilibrata. Merita!

Robe dorée trouble avec un mince col de mousse. Arômes de pommes fermentées, pêche, alcool, épices et coriandre. Un léger malt sucré en arrière-plan. En bouche, saveurs de sucre de fruits, alcool et coriandre.  Pointes de clou de girofle, pain frais venant des levures, citron et orange. Goût doux en général. Légères traces de poivre moulu, un peu herbacé. Texture moyennement épaisse, bon corps soutenue. Une tripel bien construite.

Bottle @ BVerys. Gold pour with a small white head. Nose of honeyed cereal. Mellow toasted bread and nuts. Pretty delicate aroma. Some apricot. The flavor is a bit hot. Substantial. Some vanilla. Oily and rich. Mellow, light toasty bitterness. Full bodied. Not flashy, but quite enjoyable.

Fine yellowish head on dark golden beer. Fruity nose, with some ureum. Mouth reveals alcohol, caramel and yeast features, estery. The beer seems underattenuated, and gives the impression of not being fermented out completely, despite the alcoholpresence.

Poured from bottle. Aromas are not very strong, but seem to be candied fruit and spices. Pours a clear golden with amber hue and white head. Taste is medium sweet. Medium to full bodied, slick texture, and soft carbonation make for a nice mouth feel. Very enjoyable, but watch out it the alcohol will sneak up on you.

Bottle from my Secret Summer Santa 2015, robinvboyer, thank you very much. Pours Golden color, white head. Aroma of caramel, sugar, candy. Taste is medium sweet, candy, lightly bitter, caramel, belgian yeast.

Pours gold with a small head.
Nose shows funky Brett, booze, sultanas, wine notes and apple cider/brandy.
Flavours include soft oak, more wine notes, funky Brett and light acidity. Some dried figs, sultanas and booze.

Bottle from Brewfest. Orange gold with lasting head and lace. Lemon spice bread herbal vanilla aroma with very mild alcohol. Vanilla tropical fruity sweetness with some bready grassy grains and herbal bitterness that lingers but not too long. Very soft medium full body soft inner carb and creamy as a mutherfucker. Complex and amazingly delicous. I usually prefer 8.5-9 abv...but woe is me. This is an amazing beer. Love it when someone on this side of the pond gets the tripel right. Wicked fucking excellent.
Poured from oversize bottle. Cloudy amber with generous lemon head leaving thick lacing. Aroma is grass, lemon zest, and muted spices. Flavour is lemon zest, grape skin, grapefruit, cloves, and hay.
Uma excelente abbey Tripel do Canadá. Muito saborosa e equilibrada, mesmo com os 10% ABV.

Bottle shared by Tom, thanks! Pours a near clear orange gold with a white head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has a nice light funk with earthy fruit and a bit of earthy grain underlying. Flavor has a bit more sweet grain with some light fruits, a bit of Belgian yeast and a touch of funky grain.
Slightly hazy golden yellow pour with a slight white head. Slightly spicy nose. Nice Belgian.
Bomber shared by Tom - thanks! Mostly clear rich gold pour with a white head. Nice herbal and spice note in this. Not too oily or cloying. Very good!

Bottle from Table & Vine. Poured into a tulip. A medium amber brew with an off white head that fades quickly. Big fruity and spice aromas. Body is on the heavy side with thick, sweet notes of fruity spice. Clove and white pepper notes with citrus, melon and honey. Decent bitterness. Long dry finish.

Fruity hop aroma with thin, white head. thick lacings on the glass. some fruit on the palate - banana, melon and maybe a hint of apple. alcohol is quite prominent, but not unlike most triples. lots of hops in the finish. Overall, a pretty solid triple. My first beer from this brewery, but anxious to try others.

Laranja vivo, espuma branca de boa formação, média estabilidade. Aroma doce que remete a cervejas belgas, laranja, manga. Paladar com dulçor médio e leve acidez, bem balanceada. Aftertaste mantém frutas amarelas, abacaxi, pêssego. Corpo médio, carbonatação leve/médio. Muito boa!

Très bonne triple belge. Pile poil sur le style et excellente. Belle couleur.
Samuel et Julien
26 juillet 1991

APPEARANCE  golden color, slightly turbid. Really white head, good lacing.
NOSE  spicy scents and coriander. 
FLAVOR  textbook tripel, taken up a notch. Spice flavors continue, evolving into banana / clove notes.

Aroma of cotton candy, raspberry, banana, some alcohol; burnished gold color, large off white head; moderately sweet, fleshy fruits, cotton candy, banana, hint of clove/spice, slightly metallic, but not overly so, herbal happiness in the finish; medium body, really nice mouthfeel; this is a really fantastic Triple.

Cor de mel, límpida. Espuma abundante e duradoura. Aroma de gengibre, laranja e especiarias. Sabor amargo, citrico, com notas de casca de laranja, florais e de especiarias. Retrogosto alcoólico, adocicado, com final amargo.
Vaaleansamea väri, niukka vaahto. Raikas tuoksu, aromikas? Roima alkoholinen suutuntuma, marjaisan makea olematta siirappinen, poltteleva jälkimaku. Hivenen tylppä viimeistely.

Dorada, clara, efervescente. Espuma blanca, no muy duradera. Aroma rico, complejo. Licórico. En boca tiene un sabor bastante agradable, de cierta complejidad. Base malteada agradable. Vainilla. Base dulce en definitiva. Pero a la vez bien especiada y frutal. Y sobre todo licórica. Madera. Pocas cervezas he probado que dejen semejante calor, que recuerda el de un buen whisky... salvo por el postgusto frutal y acaramelado... Es cerveza. Para ocasiones especiales...

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Barrel aged triple from a 60 cl bottle, at Chez Moeder Lambic Original. Thick, very creamy and lacing, light yellowish white, dense head, colour clear orange blonde, hazy with deposit. Pleasant and elegant aroma of orange juice, caramel, ginger, banana, pink grapefruit, white wine, white bread, peach, honey, banana and whisky. Fruity, rounded onset, pineapple, banana and mango, medium carbo, soft bready and slightly caramelly maltiness, spicy yeasty accents, citrussy, lightly spicy hop bitterness in the finish but gentle and soft, yeasty accents lingering along with woody tannins and brandy- or whisky-like, warming but gentle alcohol. Well balanced, flawless and interesting tripel, in fact among the better ones in this style I had so far.

A finger of white head, golden color in this poorly lit bar. Not much in the way of smell, but its probably my nosr today. Soft malts and cream taste, general sweetness and little oak harsh on the finish.
Ölföreningen 2015. Smak och doft av belgisk jäst, aprikos, päron och äpple. Stor sötma och kropp, fina smaker, välbalanserad, fin beska. Riktigt gott!
Bottle @ WWT. Aroma has some fruit, malt, herbal and spicy notes, also swamp. Flavour is malty peppery fruity notes. Okay, but a bit weird.
At bottleshare in Seattle. Rich orange, white soapy head. Dense banana, clove, creamy body. Belgian strong ale, lots of alc. Odd carbonation. Grew on me.

Flaska från Saveur-bier, drucken med ölföreningen. Gyllenfärgad, champagnelikande utseende. En riktigt trevlig trippel, stor kropp, lätt munkänsla, väldigt välbalanserad utan störande sötma eller alkohol med fina söta smaker av äpple och päron men torrare avslutning. Riktigt gott.
Bouteille de 600ml dambré. Arôme décorce dorange de miel. Au gout cest puissant pour commencer ensuite vient des notes de fruit, de malt et un équilibre de sucre.
On tap at Erzbierschof Black Rider, Zurich. Clear, deep golden with a medium head. Fruity, a bit alcoholic nose, hints of herbs, banana. Semi-sweet, good fruit, hints of marcipane. A decent tripel.

Golden clear color with little foam. The smell is yeasty and a bit banana like. The taste is boozy and sweet. Banana notes and a creaminess that would turn some whipped cream jealous. A little spicey and a fine carbonation that are both a little overaggressive on the first sip.

Very golden color with white head. Banana, spices, alcohol, but not too much. More bananas and spices, fruity light feeling, a bit boozy as well, but not too much. Damn creamy mouthfeel and easy to drink for this ABV. Good!

Némi kihagyás után a palack megnyitását követően ízlelőbimbóim ismét tripelek jellegzetességeit érezhették magukon, ráadásul nem is akármilyen márka főzete kezdte el vésni a névjegyét az első kortyok alatt. Sápadt méz színű teste puha habkalapot visel, a poharában megforgatva pillanatok alatt Belgiumba repít minket a virágos maláta és parfümös élesztő rég nem tapasztalt karaktere. Könnyed, lágy ízei selymesen teltek, harapható a mézzel meghintett gabonafélék jelenléte, frissítően csípős zárása pedig mintegy összerántja a kompozíciót, feszessé teszi a szerkezetet. Vidám hangulatú, autentikus tripel képét hordozza minden egyes porcikája az italnak, nagy örömömre szolgált a kanadai úriemberrel történt összeismerkedés.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontenas.
Clear amber colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, spices and candies with notes of rubber.
Fruity flavor of hops, caramel and spices with notes of candies, alcohol and white wine.
Fruity finish.

Light malty bread, molasses, sugar and spice aroma. Maybe a sweet dough aroma from the yeast as well. Nice appearance, rocky white long lasting head with excellent lacing.Hazy light amber colour. Moderately sweet taste and warming spice of alcohol. Light medium oily palate with lively carbonation. I love Dominus Vobiscum and bought this on a recommendation of the retailer.

On tap at The Knick. Sweet honey aroma, musky with light tang, a little vaporous. Medium body with heavy carbonation. Dark amber clear with thin white lacing head. Starts sweet with lots of honey, pilsener malt, mild caramel. Good yeasty, eatery notes with a bit of tangy sweet funk. Mild bitter finish and carbonic fizziness. Really nice tripel.

Style: triple belge
Ibu: -
Description: biere belge qui ressemble etrangement a une dominus vosbiscum double

from la Mise en Bière - clear golden-bronze beer with a solid and creamy white foam; estery and light yeasty fruity finish (pears and apples dominate); creamy palate, sweet and subtle yet lively carbonation; light residual sweetness and long notes of marzipan, quince and pears - pretty impressive
60 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a huge white head. Mild winegrape aroma. Toasted malty. Smooth. Mellow and fruity. Vague metalluc. Lingering fruity.

Bottle shared @ home from HappyHoppy - Clor: hazy blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: mat domination, ester notes and floral finish. Taste: good malt taste with good balance of flower and grassy finish. Aftertaste: malt taste and alcohol finish. Really a nice beer, a must to try !
Sample sips stolen from Helsdons glass at the Rate Beer Winter Wipeout at the Only Cafe brings lots of yeast & sugar to the tongue. Sharp finish. Decent but not mind blowing.
Creative onterpretation of a tripel. Slightly more acidic than most. maybe a bit less balanced than what I hoped. Overall still a good beer.
Cobriza, con un buena capa de espuma blanca con buena retención. Aromas a hierba, pan y levadura belga. Cuerpo medio. En boca algo especiada y dulce. Alcohol bien integrado. Una buena cerveza belga.

Bottle from local IGA grocery A: pear, coriander, herbacy app: hazy golden white head good lacing. T/p: full body with sweet finish of medium duration. Some warmness. Moderate carbonation. O: great. A thing of beauty. Cant believe its 10%. Subtle and intriguing.

Bottle from Pasquier. Aroma: cereals, tropical fruits, citrus, App: clear copper with light-medium white head. Taste and Palate: medium body, light sweetness with light dry acidity and alcohol finish. Carbonation is soft. Overall: Pretty good. Really enjoyed the palate on this one. Wasnt expecting this dry acidity and alcohol comforting finish.
Clear amber, off white head. Aroma of rising bread dough, white pepper, citrus. Taste is sweet hay and light spice.
Bottle. Odd sour vinegar aroma. Taste has notes of that vinegar sour aroma, but is also sweet and spicy. Citrus notes. Unique and tasty.
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with a beige head. Aroma is fruit, malt, sugar, alcohol. Flavour is fruit, malt, sugar, alcohol, caramel, yeast. Full body. Nice beer.

Butelka 60cl.
OCZY : piwo jest przejrzyste o kolorze pomiędzy złocistym i miedzianym. Piana jest trwała ale nie jest obfita. Piana ma kolor śnieżnobiały. 

NOS : piwo emanuje aromatem biszkopta i typowych estrów belgijskich, przede wszystkim morela. Do tego mocne aromaty skórki cytryny, ciasta imbirowego i subtelne aromaty przypraw takich jak kardamon, kurkuma i szafran. Rozpuszczalnik.

USTA : piwo jest średnio gazowane i tłuste. 
Słodkie o mocnym smaku ciasta imbirowego z przyprawami i podkreślonych nutach moreli i owoców z puszki. Alkohol jest wyczuwalny ale nie czuć tych 10%. Gorzkość delikatna i mocno zdominowana. W posmaku wciąż dominują owocowe estry o kandyzowanych nutach i ciasto z przyprawami. Posmak jest długi i piekący.

Smooth fresh sweetish beginning. Fresh smooth beginning. Sweetish-smooth beer, deep-fruity, easy to drink, fresh, smooth great! The alcohol is not tastable!! Great!

Thanks erzengel!! Pours a hazy gold color with an off-white head. The smell is honey, sweet malt, fruit. The taste is rich malt, fruit, mild caramel ending dry and fruity. The body is medium with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 375ml bottle from St. Veronus. Dark for a triple, light amber, with a creamy/slightly foamy medium sized head with nice coating lacing. Quite sweet on the nose with sweet caramel, candy sugar, home-made toffee, maple syrup, plastic and peach. Bitterness on the finish that is dry and alcohol fronted. Elevated alcohol and medium-high bitterness.
Oily sweet trash water with some redeemable tartness and barrel character. The sweetness comes across like Splenda to me. Spoiled fruit and hot sour grains. Really messy oddity.

375 ml bottle. Pours a golden colour with a small head. Aroma of grainy malts, some straw and apricot. Flavour of sweetness, apricot, residual sugar, grainy malts, pear and straw. Medium bodied. Alcohol comes through. Not my thing.

375 ml bottle.
Pours golden color with a small head. Stuffy and leathery aroma, some faint yeast and orange, faint herbal notes too. Fruity toffee flavor, some wood and spices with mild yeast notes and some sugar. Slight alcohol burn at the end. Decent, maybe a bit too boozy.

Pours clear copper orange with a smooth head. Aroma of spices, grassy hops, pine, citrus and malts. Taste is spicy, citrusy and grassy with some fruits and malty notes. Finish is warming, sweetish and ripe fruity with some spices and grassy notes. Heavy and fruity tripel.

37,5 cl bottle @ lusikka, bottled 19.09.2013
Aroma has strong soapy citrus notes and apricot. Also some mint. Flavour has mint, soapy apricot, citrus and grassy hops. Foamy palate. Finishes with phenolic alcohol tones. Nice, although a bit too boozy.
750, way to osweet and uniform for me. Not enough complexity and balance. I wasnt a fan at all.

At Eurhop festival in Rome-ITALY. Pours golden hazy, white foamy head leaving a draft in the surface. Nose: immediately you can spot acidic notes (?!), vinegar, spumante. Mouth: alcohol, sweet (too sweet).

From tap in the Alibi Room.
Aroma had overipe apple, a bit chemical, but got distracted by the huge smell of weed outside.

Taste: sweeter than I expected, appel, pear, dry sweet finish.

text: Pours with no head. Spice and honey on the nose. Lots of honey and a bit of bubblegum taste. Smooth with low carbonation.
Goldenes Bier mit ordentlicher weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch säuerlich malzig, hefig, Gewürze. Geschmack säuerlich, fruchtig, reife Früchte.

I sure liked this. It sure was a tonne-of-bricks slugger though. Poured a hazy dark amber with a thin crown. Smells of honey, yeast, bubblegum and floral fun. Pretty caramel-sweet, quite malty, boozy and floral to taste as well. The slightly oily feel and low carbonation make this one enjoyable but tough to conquer Tripel tipple.
Bottle 750ml - yellow to light orange body. Typical tripel aroma. More than solid taste, however. Lots of caramel, dried fruit, some sugar and light citrus. All very elegantly packed.

Pours amber with white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of malts, certs, bubblegum and honey. Tastes of the same with booze added. Lingering boozy warm aftertaste. Oily mouthfeel. 10pct abv is hidden well, but still a little boozier than I would prefer.

Well, she hits like a tonne of bricks. Pours a hazy amber with a head that was instantly gone. Aroma was of bubblegum, yeast, honey, and floral hops. Tasted of caramel malts, floral hops, and fruity esters. She hides the booze flavour too well, but warms when going down. Has low carbonation with a oily feel and a sweet candy aftertaste. Would love to dry again when not so loaded already.

Bottle 375ml. [ As Le Trou du Diable La Buteuse ].Clear medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to white head. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20140705]
Creamy white head, clear golden. Spicy, sweet, dried fruits, alcohol well hidden. Dangerously drinkable for such a strong tripel.
It's a 10% Tripel Belgian with dried fruit taste. Sweet and malty. The aroma is nothing compared to the strong taste.
très bonne bière en général bonne texture avec un gros amer et corsé cependant une finition légèrement fruité et sucré. assez houblonne surtout pour un type de bière belge

Je les buts en bouteille. Une des meilleur biere du quebec a mon avis, Elle est sucré avec son arome fruité.Elle saccompagne bien avec du fromage du saguenay lac saint jean tel que le PIKAUBA de la FROMAGERIE LEHMANN ou peut importe quelle fromage fin.
Clear golden of color with a white foamy head. An aroma of herbs, spice, sweets and brett. A flavor of spice, sweets, brett, wood and alcohol.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, malt, alcohol, grass and hops.Sweet and light bitter finish.

Bottle, 10%. Clear amber with medium white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, caramel, little funk and a little orange peel. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, yeast, little funk, little dry, little over carbonated, little sweet, notes of alcohol and medium bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with lots of alcohol. 050714

Draft @ ML Fontainas, Québec festival.
Léger orangée, col crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme est fruité, léger ester avec un bouquet levure très belge et un appui nasal de houblons nobles.
Palais au profil typiquement belge surtout au niveau de lusage de la levure. Léger côté ester avec un petit sucré collant aux lèvres. Pointe herbacée et une amertume modérée aux notes nobles. Pointe dabricot, sec et herbacé sur un malté pâle et pils?

Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is banana, peach, more fruits, some spices, honey. Medium body with taste on the sweet and spicy side and a medium alcool finish.

Dégustée (en fût) le 1er mars 2014 lors de la Cuvée dHiver 2014 à Montréal. Bière dorée limpide. Très peu effervescente. Assez forte, assez sucrée, peu amère. Saveur de miel, de céréales, de sucre. Très bonne, se boit bien, rafraîchissante. Alcool bien présent mais ne ressort pas trop.

BOTTLE 375ML from bunget. Thanks, Sergio!

Look: hazy golden-amber with yeast flakes and a big white creamy head.
Aroma: blond fruit - apricot, peach, pine-apple, spicy yeast, some alcohol (quite rough) and some kind of oily fresh bread crust.
Taste: nice and mellow, fruit sweetness (grapes?), alcoholic, some phenolic spice, minimal bitterness. A very nice tripel, soft and mellow, on the sweet side. A tad too much alcohol, i guess.

Pours a clear amber gold with a fat finger of loose white head diminishing gradually to a medium cap and moderate lacing. Nose is characteristic Belgian yeast, bananas and cloves, spiciness, orange peel, and caramel malt. Taste follows the nose completely, with a (surprisingly) little alcohol finish. Spiced, fruits, honey, bread crump and belgian yeast. Some citrus hint. Slick.

Draft at the Sybarite Pig in Boca Raton, FL. Snifter. Pours a deep yellow haze with a thick fluffy head. The head actually lasted and laced nicely. Aroma is bread, dough, Belgian yeasts, flowers, honey, herbs/spices, and fruity esters. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation. Fairly sweet finish. A really nice tripel.

Une blonde dorée assez limpide malgré ses nombreuses particules en suspension, un épais col mousseux qui se sauve rapidement domine la bière. Des esters fruités et floraux se joignent à une pointe épicée pour émoustiller les narines. Une belle complexité en bouche est agréablement facile à boire malgré les 10% dalcool bien marqués. Des céréales mielleuses, des fruits, des épices et un enrobage dalcool chaleureux à la fin font de cette Buteuse un plaisir que lon voudra répéter régulièrement.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Pours a nice golden with a medium creamy white head that leaves pretty good lacing. Aroma is of fruits and light alcohol, pleasing. Taste is sweet and grainy, flour-y even. Flavors of fruits and light spices. Alcohol is really well hidden in taste. Body is medium, texture oily. Carbonation is low to medium. This isnt the Brassin Spécial but it still hold its own. Good beer!
Très bonne bière à découvrir surtout par des soir froid de nos longue hiver elle vous rechaufferas et vous detenderas devant un bon match de hockey

Head is average size, creamy, white with good lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is hazy medium amber. Flavor starts moderately sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet, acidic and bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, oily with a lively carbonation and a tart finish. The weight and texture is perfect for this slightly sour Abbey Tripel.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2015 Pours a clear gold with moderate head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, fruit/peaches and toasted malts. Flavors of stoned fruit, citrus, apples, and lightly toasted malts. Smooth. Very enjoyable.
Miam miam, que cest bon ça!! Le parfum est vraiment incroyable; cest surprenant que ça sente aussi différent de ce que ça goûte. Produit de très grande qualité.

de couleur oranger avec col genereux de couleur blanche on sens des note malte avec un un cote fruite avec un gout epice poivre en bouche c est un gout complexe qu on goute comme un malt tres fruite suivie epice exotique en bouche c est divin
On tap at le sur mesure in Nantes. Yellow color with a white big foam.Belgian yeast. A little bit sweet but not too much. Nice bitter ending and you dont feel the 10°. Very nice. N

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours orange gold with a whiteish head. Smells like a tripel with a hint of pineapple in the aroma. Full bodied. Flavor is yeast spice with mixed fruit esters and just a hint of funk. Amazing ale.
Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours golden with a nice off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a carbonated caramel malt flavor with some pineapple and a finishing burn. A nice Tripel.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Bière jaune orangée, de lor liquide, voilée avec particules en suspension bien visibles, très effervescente, surmontée dun bon col couleur crème, dense et mousseux, et bien résistant. Arômes de pain frais et de levure typiquement belge, avec beaucoup de fruités (pêche, poire, abricot, agrumes, mangue, cantaloup, raisin vert, banane), un houblon plutôt floral avec également notes dherbes et dépinette, un malt mielleux, du poivre, et dautres épices plus subtils (clou de girofle, coriandre, muscade). Très beau nez, belle complexité, excellente intensité. En bouche, pétillement moyen-fort sur la langue, et onctuosité au palais très intéressante, cest soyeux et velouté, le corps est riche et dune rondeur remarquable. Au goût, pain frais, levure typiquement belge, abondant fruité (avec domination de la pêche et des fruits tropicaux), malt mielleux, et épices (surtout du poivre, mais aussi du clou de girofle, de la muscade, de la coriandre). Lalcool est bien présent en bouche, tout de même plutôt subtil au goût, il envahit le dégustateur de sa douce sensation chaleureuse. Le houblon se fait plus subtil au goût quau nez, apparaissant surtout en fin de bouche, il semble à la fois floral et résineux. Lamertume de cette bière est assez légère, la finale se voulant plutôt alcoolisée. Lintégration des différentes saveurs entre elles est impeccablement réussie, et le résultat en est un breuvage fort complexe, très intense et agréablement chaleureux. Excellente bière! /// Note : Faire vieillir cette bière en cellier en décuplera ses flaveurs de malt fruité (fruits du verger, pêche surtout) et mielleux, ce qui est bien intéressant

A great tripel, but nowhere near as good as the brandy oak version. Pours a cloudy but bright golden yellow with a head of fuzzy off white. The nose is fresh, citrus and tropical fruits blending well with grassy hops and mild esters. A nice crisp finish with a typical tripel finish, clean, dry and mildly bitter.

375 mL bottle. Pours medium amber with a nice white cap. Aromas of Belgian yeast spice, banana, grain, mango, and bubblegum. A slight sweetness, well balanced by above average carbonation, a touch of hop and a hint of alcohol. Medium body with a nice long finish. Dangerously drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Bière de couleur ambrée avec un très grand col blanc assez résistant. Nez de malt et de houblon. En bouche fruits,miel,pain, chaleur dalcool sur une grande amertume . Ce la reste une excellente bière qui semble complexe mais qui est assez simple.

Maybe the best triple Ive ever had. I cant believe how smooth this is considering the high alcohol. Great aromas of Belgian candy and banana. Some tropical fruit too. Flavors are sweet and smooth. Similar to the aromas. An amazing beverage.

Pours a hazy copper, effervescent, and a small long lasting white head leaving traces of lace. Aroma is caramel, orange, pepper, fruity, sweet+spicy alcohol, and perfumy notes. Flavour is toffee, chocolate, citrus, sweet maltiness, soft alcohol, peppery spice, fruity, and a mild bitterness.

Pours a cloudy golden bronze with a frothy off white head and no lace. Aroma of vanilla, toffee, light caramel, alcohol, Belgian yeast, coriander and sweet bananas. Taste is spicy Belgian yeast, sweet banana, coriander and alcohol. The finish has a nice smooth alcohol warmth to it with a medium high carbonation. Overall its very well balanced and smooth for a 10 point beer.

Bière blonde de 10 % dalcool. Elle ne possède aucun col au versement. Elle possède un goût sucré et un goût comme de cassonade. Elle possède un goût de torréfaction et/ou de toffee. Elle possède un odorat de sucre et aussi un goût de girofle. Très bonne !

Halflitre bottle from Coop. Had this big beer with a big steak, lots of oven roasted veggies. Huge frothy head erupts from this golden pour in my st. ambroise chalice. uper carbonation, medium-high alcohol warmth. Typical unibroue yeastiness on the nose, citrus, orange zest, coriander, all-spicey noble hop zest. Unreal smoothness and zestiness on the palate. Delicieux.
Orangée, trouble avec un petit collet de mousse blanche. Nez fruité et épicé, dorange et de levures. Goût sucré, de malt, dorange encore, dépices et dalcool. Légère amertume.

Cuivrée et limpide, une mousse épaisse tisse une élégante dentelle en se résorbant. Le nez est très bon, charmé par des arômes de levure, dagrumes, de miel et de vanille. En bouche cest épicée et minéral, où la levure tient à ce quon la remarque. Légère acidité et légère amertume qui se donnent des élans grâce à la base maltée. Bottle 375ml.
Pours golden with low white head. Aroma is of alcohol, malt, fruits. Taste is of malt, fruits, alcohol. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Overall: Very good. Nice malt features. Good balance. Belgian.

375ml bottle from Monde des Bières.
Appearance : Clear pale amber with medium foamy white head. Lots of lacing.

Aroma : Belgian yeast spices with fruity notes. Some orange peel and marmalade. Malty and yeasty. Light banana notes.

Taste : Yeasty with spices. Marmalade with light bitter hops. Finish is spicy with light brown sugar and belgian yeasty esters. Light bananas on the late finish. Light mineral notes. Slightly warm finish but quite less than the abv would suggest.

Overall : Really well balanced palate. The body is great but not too heavy. A bit too spicy for my taste. Nice yeasty notes. Fairly nice example of a tripel. Gets a bit hot when warmer.
bottle. pours dark deep orange. has a very nice white head. aroma is like a funky saison. taste is very faint lemon and hay with some nice hop.

Flavor is subtle fruit (peach, mango), white cake, yeast, sweetbread. But definitely not very strongly flavored, everything feels kind of faint. Almost no bitterness, mostly just sugar. Light body, soft mouthfeel, average carbonation. Good tripel, but I felt it was not on par with my expectations...

The flavor is sweet malts, caramel, yeast, floral, herbal and a hint of peppery spice. The alcohol is noticeable.

Aroma: Very fruity Belgium yeast nose, with banana, bubble gum, cinnamon, cardamom and wood accents. Typical Belgium fruity and spicy nose. Wide variety of accents.
Visual: Very clear gold / amber, with a moderately thin rocky head. Average lasting and discreet lacing.
Taste: Attack is fruity with a good sparkling feel, well married to spices. Sweet accents of banana, orange, mandarin. Notes of pineapples giving a soft acidity. Also a lot of spices: cinnamon, pepper, cardamom. Very good balance between fruits and spices. However, hops are kind of discreet. Mouth feel presents a very interesting roundness. A lot of body with a creamy texture. Alcohol is not aggressive but well supporting the flavors. Une agréable triple; ronde, enveloppante, savoureuse et épicée. Bien réussie.

En arrière-goût, un mélange habile de houblon et de cassonade, qui séquilibrent de façon exceptionnelle.
Très levuré et tomaté en arôme, un peu moins au goût. Le corps est velouté et chargé de sucres résiduels. De loin inférieur au brassin spécial.
Light orange with a good white head. Aroma is apple brandy, wood, peach, musk, Brett, oak. Woody on the palate, dry oak and spice finish. Taste is grape skins, oak, peach, citrus zest.
Bottle share. Clear orange. Aroma and taste of sour green apple, wood, apricot. Nice.

500mL bottle, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike), pours a dark-ish golden orange with a small white head. Nose brings out yeast, floral hops, some dry apple skins, and some phenols. Flavour brings out loads of yeast, dry apple skins, floral hops, phenols and alcohol. Very boozy and phenolic, though very yeast and dry as well. The booze cuts through big time, not making this the easiest drinking tripel out there, but at least its dry and without that nasty apple-y sweetness of many North American tripels. Decent stuff, but too many flaws.

Pours a hazy dark orange with white head and nice lacing. Aroma has lots of hoyed malts, spices, booze. Taste still has thoses honeyed malts at first, then some classix tripel spices, fruity, peppery, sweetness, boozy ( a bit too much ). Full body and medium to low carb. Good tripel and definitly a sipper.

Petit col de mousse sur un liquide orange ambré mi-épais, arômes fruités de levure belge, alcool bien contrôlé. En bouche, alcool réchauffant, pêches, abricots, caramel, petite amertume houblonnée, belle effervescence contenue. Une tripel assez ronde, passablement sucrée et fruitée, et même lamertume finale ne vient pas amoindrir cette vague de puissantes saveurs qui, à la limite, sont trop accaparantes. Plutôt bonne, mais le brassin spécial constitue une amélioration par rapport à celle-ci.

Blonde limpide et peu mousseuse qui tire sur lorangé. Un nez subtile de houblons fruités se dégage (je sens des oranges fraîchement coupées) avec une pointe levurée typiquement belge. En bouche, les oranges reviennent nous charmer, supportées par un savant mélange dépices, avec lalcool qui simpose en finale. Javais toujours bu la Buteuse Brassin Spécial et je me disais que le vieillissement en fût de brandy ne faisait certainement pas tout le travail; ça prenait une grande bière en-dessous de tout ça. Et je crois que la Buteuse, dans sa version traditionnelle, est une grande bière.

Bouteille 600 ml. 10%. Couleur ambrée, mousse blanche qui maintient un mince col. Arôme de céréale, agrumes et un peu dépices douces. En bouche, notes de fruits, levure, agrumes, alcool. Finale, herbes, agrumes et levure persistante.
Bottle, pours pale yellow, aroma was spicy and yeasty, the flavour was pretty standard triple, kind of a dry bitterness, overall not bad

750 ml bottle.  Clear golden orange with white froth.  Nose is apricot, orange peel, pineapple and sour peach.  Syrupy medium body with a sharp tang and building warmth.  Taste is candi, overripe pear, dried apricot and bitter orange.  A bit cloying, displaying the characteristics i dont like in a tripel but executed so well its not overly offensive.  Makes the oak aged version seem all the more magical.

Pours a pale yellow-orange with a bit of white head. Smell is caramel, cloves, and fruit. Palate is medium bodied with good carbonation. Taste is sweet at first, then gets bitter, which the subsides to mix with the sweetness in the aftertaste. Really good tripel.

Bready, sweet, spicy, yeasty nose. The nose is so sweet it almost reminds me of honeydew. Very interesting. Beautiful looking beer, copper brown and long lasting white head. From the look of it, I would assume its an IPA in the glass. Taste is mild at the beggining, but quickly expands to show maltiness  and a long spicy finish. Quite well balanced and light bodied. Alcohol is amazingly masked. Not the biggest fan of the style, but very interesting take on it.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Clear amber with a decent off-white head.
  
Aroma:  Pungent, plucky coriander veering towards ginger, very sweet, honey, slightly floral, fairly boozy, biscuit/bread crust, spicy, slightly peppery, boozy fruitiness, big stuff.
  
Palate:  Medium++ body, velvety effervescence.
  
Flav.:  More strong, zingy coriander and ginger, lemony, tons of alcohol, not necessarily objectionable, but certainly requires restraint and respect, sweet, biscuit, bread crust, yeast, citrus peel; sweet with moderate-low bitterness, lots of alcohol and a long, coriander/ginger, honey/biscuit finish.

Really big Tripel.  Do not underestimate this big boy!

500mL Lickbow bottle. Props to the LICBO for acquiring more Quebecois beer! Pours a hazy reddish gold with a nice white cap. The aroma is awesome, some standard Abbey Tripel elements mixed with peach, tangerine, and yeast. A flowery bouqet of yeast features prominently. The aspects of the flavour that really stand out are the fruity elements of peach and orange, as well as dry yeast and minor booze astringency. A nice and lively take on a style that can too often be abrasive and unpleasant. Over-all this is a very enjoyable beverage from a brewery that I will most definitely have to explore more of when I get the chance to cross the river next.

It pours translucent amber with copper highlights, its very cloudy; the head is off-white and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: pineapple, apricot, grapefruit, and alcohol. The taste is light sweet that finishes medium-heavy bitter; there are notes of: pineapple, short-bread, white-grapefruit, and alcohol. The palate is medium bodied, has medium carbonation (tiny bubbles), slight stickiness, and a long bitter finish. Overall, very flavourful, but needs body.

Odeur mielleuse, floral et épicé.  Belle robe dorée, mousse persistante.

Chause et ronde en bouche, sucvre léger. amertume très douce

Single bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy golden colour with a creamy-frothy off-white head that goes down quicker that what I expected, fizzing away and leaving a little lace, but not much. Fruity nose of grapefruit, orange and lime, with the Belgian Ale yeast and mild hop. No burning at all, almost no warming mouthfeel. Sweet tasting malt grain, but not overly like syrup. Balancing things are the spices, hop, Belgian Ale yeast, apples and light vanilla in the finish. Maybe not the best Tripel, but way above average.

Copper red pour with a light tan head. Aroma of dried fruit, raisins, apricots and cherries, heavy waft of biscuity yeast and notes of alcohol and seasonal spices. Good balance between sweet-yeast-hops, with nice citrus and resin notes from the hops, and a mellow sweetness from the malts. A little heavy on the alcohol for my liking, but still, very well balanced... warms you up on a Canadian winter day! Finish of floral hops and more alcoholic glow! Great brew!

Red amber look, off white head in my Duvel tullip.
As printed on label smells of belgian yeast, spices yes, fruits like apricots, dried peaches, sweet alcohol, herbal pine or juniper note.
Liking that bite from the noble hops. Good bitterness, citrus lemon-lime. Not too sweet, but firm caramel malt, candi sugar..? Alco-punch.
On the palate, med-low carb, noble-hop bittering, little syrup, slight stickiness. At 10.5 a potent, but plenty approachable triple. Comforting warmth of alcohol, indeed. 
Different brew, like a hopped up Quad?

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a murky orange colour with modest-sized near white head.  Aroma is very spicy/yeasty with sharp grape.  Flavour is dry grape and apple, clove and pepper.  Alcohol is apparent.  Drying finish.  Nice.

2013/02/17 - Pours an amber/orange with a thin white head. Aromas are yeast, spices and dark fruit, mainly grapes. Taste is similar to nose. Starts out sweet and finishes aggressive, but maintains smoothness. Thin to medium mouthfeel. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle lcbo pours a healthy fine carbonation forming a white head over a medium amber coat, wafting aromas of deep pale fruit like Muscat grape and hops and tingling spice. Sharp bitterness and a lot of alcoholic warmth leading into some spicy and bubblegum phenols and also the winey muscat and fruit, which rounds over a full palate leading to a round yet dry long warm finish that shows the spicy and the hop. Not a style I drink often but so solid!

Well, the description says this is for draft only - but the picture on the bottle matches mine.  Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spot lacing to coat surface. Oak and sour fruit aromas. Soft with sweet marshmallow and caramel upfront turning to sour summer fruit before the lasting bitter finish.

Fantastic brew. Rich and velvety mouth feel and a light fruity and sweet palette. This was well worth the wait. It's a disservice, but it's like a "Light" Quad.. so rich and complex, but muted. Hands down the best Canadian Triple I've tried. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

La Buteuse pours (from a bottle into a snifter) a cloudy amber orange with a thin ring of white head. A big, bread-y yeast aroma is complemented with sharp, peppery spice, marmalade, and sweet sugar. There is a little hint of grape (maybe more raisin) and some funkiness, for some reason Im reminded of a trip to Niagara wine country! Its starts quite sweet and ends quite bitter. Full bodied and aggressive carbonation with a very pleasant alcohol warmth. A brasher approach to the Abbey Tripel which is really worth seeking out.
Not bad for a Canadian imitation trappist ale! Lovely nose, taste and finish. Awsome job La Buteuse.

Lovely beer! Pours light amber with an initial foamy head that dissipates to a nice almond ring. Some lacing. Nose is spicy. Aromas start with fruit and some candy, and then comes a bitter and spicy bite. Finish is harsh. Tastes are light sweet and medium bitter. Mouthfeel is very aggressive from the carbonation and the alcohol burn.
from notes at Cask Days 2011. Cloudy orange amber colour w. almost no head. Intense aromas of malt, dried fruit and bready yeast.  Flavours os sweet malts and lingering warming alcohol.

On tap at Lord Hobo - Cambridge, MA. Zesty, spiced and somewhat woody. Flavors are solid, warming, and rich. Theres an edge of harshness to the phenols that makes this a little tough to get through and thats a character of many Belgian yeast-fermented North American examples that I always have trouble with. Finishes spicy with a bit of cream undertone. Good, clean, and complex, but the yeast character was missing the soft, roundness I look for.

At Cask Beer Festival 2012 
Aroma:  strong grassy front with spicy finish. Slight tart hints, touch of grape.7+
Appearance:  poured amber with hazy clarity. Lasting medium light top.3+
Taste/Palate/Body:  Belgian character with herbal hop feel on sides. Tad funky , slightly tart as well. Hint of grape as in aroma. Medium bodied, smooth ale with semi dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Rerate from bottle. Deep golden pour. The aroma is awesome - lots of lean tropical fruit, peppery spiciness and a little bit of light hoppiness. Bright and perfumey with loads of mango, pineapple and a very delicate citrusy aroma. The malts are lean but they are distinctly present. A touch of white pepper and some subtle honeyish aroma and flavour. Incredibley fresh and spicy. There is a touch of wheat or rye spiciness in here as well. Damn - this is even better than I gave it credit for the first time around - sublime.
Hazy amber pour. Rich spicy aroma. Softly hoppy with a nice Belgian spice aroma. Fresh and peppery with a touch of herbal character. Lovely.
8 4 8 4 16
Tried from cask at Toronto Cask Days festival.  Pours and looks great.  The aroma was strong from the pour.  Taste of sweet fruit and some spicy notes made for a smooth and beautiful drink.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2012 August 8, 2012 - on draught at Volo.  Hazy amber-bold with a smallish fizzy beige head.  Smells of oak (dont know why, this one is definitely not barrel-aged), tangerine, herbal bitterness and alcohol (7+).  Taste follows, but in greater intensity and it meshes so well, reminds me of marmelade a bit.  Sticky, boozy, decently carbonated, has a fruity bitter finish - simple, a really nice drinker.

500 ml bottle poured a hazy golden amber with a lasting ivory head. Aromas of biscuit, spice, apple, pear, yeast and a hint of oak. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, spice, pear, light oak and light yeast with a crisp dry lingering fruity finish.

On tap at 20th Vermont Brewers Festival. Liked this much better then the oaked version and happy to have tried it on tap. Brickish with a biege head. Belgian yeast, spices, some vanilla, doughy malts, alcohol, surprising fruit. High carbonation yet still smooth, full body, slight bitterness at first then becomes more sweet, alcohol, some fruit - tasty.

Smells awesome from the get-go. Citrus, banana bread yeast and some booze.  Pours pretty clear blond with suds typical of style. Some lacing. Taste has good soft carbonation on palate and atouch of sharp bitterness at the end. Triple perfume present throughout taste. Great all around package. Finally got ahold of this on tap at volos on a monday 5$ pint night. Usually way too expensive for a 500 milli bottle.

Sampled at the GCBF. Amber at bottom working its way up to ruby. This head breeds webs. Aroma: Alcohol, peach, bitter taste... is not cloying whatsoever, which is often a problem for me. I didnt care much for Karmeliet, so take this review with a grain of salt. Apricots. Wow. Spiced juiciness. Finish is bittersweet. Freshest tasting tripel Ive ever had. So well balanced... every aspect blends together so well. This is approaching mastercraft. Its as if they made a beer out of an apricot. Best of show.

Draught at Volo, August 8. Pours a deep cloudy orange-amber with a small lasting creamy white head. Aroma and flavour are quite fruity along with some light sugary sweetness, caramel malt, a hint of spice and quite a bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden.  Medium bodied. Great stuff!

pours filtered apple juice reddish brown with a nice frothy head, micro CO2, some fast moving CO2 streams. Fresh pressed apple cider on the nose. A woody unfiltered fresh pressed apple juice up front, light alcohol, calvados, medium malts, cinnamon/nutmeg, oak, brandy, and a medium sweetness (7/10) in the mids, followed by a crisp semi-sweet, almost light salty & light bittersweet finish. Medium-high compexity, medium depth, great transitions, great carry, excellent drinkabiltity. My type of beer: fruity, oaky, and packs a punch.

On draft at Rustico in Alexandria, VA.

Full pour shared between me, Paul & Mike.

The beer appears a hazy, golden orange hue with a finger of head. As the head recedes, it leaves some good lacing in its wake. The aroma brings a heavy dose of spices and alcohol, followed by more subtle notes of yeast and citrus. The flavor is bold and forward - this is a big beer. The taste is decent, but I would guess / hope that spending a few years in the cellar would serve to improve this brew. As this was sampled on draft, that obviously wasnt an option at the time. In general, I found the beer to be a bit too hot, with flavors sort of running together, lacking cohesion. Id be interested to try the barrel-aged version, though at $30 per bottle, I dont imagine its worth it.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 04-01-2011

On tap at Bar Volo. Appearance: Cloudy orange, small white head. Aroma: hoppy, fruity,  a little spice and quite a lot of yeast. Flavour: Tangy, oranges, peel/zest, sticky mouthfeel. Long bitter boozy finish.

On tap at TDD. Pous clear golden with tiny white head. Aroma and flavour: belgian yeast, malt, alcohol. Nice well balanced sweetness. Long lasting taste. Full bodied beer, good carbonation. Right on style, but lacks a little variety on the aroma/flavour. A bit heavy.

Amber colour.  Thin head.  Has some candyish notes on the nose with floral accents.  Very sweet, hurts my teeth.  Floral notes, not all that yeasty otherwise.  The 10% doesnt show, probably because the beer is too syrupy.

Enjoyed from the bottle, pours a lovely orange with a soft wispy head.  Aroma has a nice malt character, floral, grass, lemon, barnyard.  Pretty strong on the palate, bitter with a long lingering finish.
Clear orange copper with a large frothy white head and lace. Pleasant fruit malt aroma. Lovely texture. Fruit, honey sweet malt flavour. Nice tangy bitter finish.

Draft at brewpub. Rich warm amber. Aroma of sweet malt, caramelized grape nut and maple. Too sweet for my taste with much sweet maple fudginess on the tongue. The only sweet TDD beer...but also doesnt seem 10%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 foamy brew. hazy orange auburn colour. Belgian yeasts, esters, nutmeg and some very floral but grassy notes. rich taste, has a boozy finish. Flavours are rich, creamy but  has a bunch of hoppy dryness action. Boozy, hot and grassy hoppy flavour make this a rich but somewhat overwhelming brew.

500ml bottle. Clear amber pour with tan head. Lots of tropical fruit on the nose with some vanilla and honey. Sweet on the palate and a little warm with more tropical fruit and honey. A little astringent perhaps.

Bottle 500 ml. Appearance: Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma: Sweet, spices, belgian yeast. Taste: Spicy, residual sugar, fruits and hints of alcohol. Overall: A nice beer but the Buteuse Brassin Spécial (age in oak apple brandy barrel with brett) is way better.
On tap at Brouhaha. Cloudy. Pears, caramel, wheat. High bitterness for a tripel. Im not a fan of that style but I found it very tasty and enjoyable.
#1126 draught; nose is some velvet dry lemon, alcohol whiff, dough, feel is medium, carb is mediumheavy, taste is sweet acidic red apple, red grapes, then mediumbroad hops bite, alcohol

bottle with a bad ass label at rbwg 3/5/11.

golden orange color with a substantial white head.

super yeasty smell and taste... along with pale malt/grainy, peppery spice, esters, citrus and hay. the yeast is overwhelming and begins to get unpleasant by the end. 6/3/6/3/13

On cask at Cask Days 2011 at Hart House, served in an English pint glass. Pours cloudy orange-golden with a small cask head. The head mostly fades and leaves a small amount of lace. The nose is spicy, with notes of fruit, pale malts, biscuit, yeast and a touch of herbal hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with flowers, pale malts and a long spicy finish. On the palate it is medium in body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a nice tripel. Not quite as complex as some others, but a very respectable brew. 2011-10-30

Cask days 2011.
Wonderful yeasty, fruity aroma. Light bready malts, with some tangy tropical fruits. Slightly high carb, mouthfeel was a little over active. Dry finish, light fruity esters, and more bready malts. Great example of the style.
Cssk Days 2011, Deep golden pour, soapy pot pourri spice notes in the aroma along with vanilla. Slight band aid, Fruity, sweet malts, a very good tripel. Impressive

on tap at brewpub. clear bright golden, creamy white head, excellent retention/lacing. nose of dusty hops, floral and light spices. malts and spices, fruity, pepper, distinctive house ale yeast, light to medium grassy-citrusy hops, acidic, vanilla. sticky mouthfeel, medium body. very good.

amber coloured with a nice, fluffy white head. leaves lots of lacing. very complex aroma of caramelized apples, wild yeast, sweet malts and fruity esters, along with alcohol. the taste is an explosion of flavours. very well balanced, it starts off with flowers and lavender, orange zest, cereal, and apples. slight but enjoyable alcohol burn. full bodied, and finely carbonated. an absolutely incredible offering from a great brewery.

Bouteille de 500ml. Bière blonde trouble avec reflets orangées. Au nez les arômes dépice sont bien présents. Les houblons sont agréables avec une touche de résine et de fruits exotiques. Le corps a une belle charpente. Les goûts dépices rares sont bien agréables. La levure agrémente le tout. Lalcool est quelque peu gouteux.
Bottle.  Clear amber, off white head. Aroma of rising bread dough, white pepper, citrus.  Taste is sweet hay and light spice.  Nice.

Bouteille 500 mL - Dégustée avec la Brassin spécial Jy vais de mémoire... Arômes dépices, de pommes et dalcool. Beau corps rond. Goût de pommes/poires, dépices le tout dans une chaleur dalcool. Bonne bière mais il manque quelque chose.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale with a huge foamy head with great retention and excellent lacing. Aroma consists of Belgian Malt with nice fruity ester and medium peppery yeast. Taste is an exceptionally well balance mix between a solid Belgian malt backbone with great notes of fruity ester and light peppery yeast. Body is quite full with great carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Triple is one of my favourite style and this is one is exceptionally well balance with sweetness not overwhelming the whole mix. Probably one of the best North American examples of the style.

On tap at Rustico in Alexandria. Served in a snifter. Thanks to Matt and Paul for sharing.

Pours a moderately-hazy golden color with a thin white head. The nose is really powerful and sends characteristics in all directions. There is some strong banana and clove plus loads of yeast spice. All of these components are quite strong and do not meld together very well. The same goes for the flavor, which dials things back a bit, but still isnt terribly pleasant. Spice, banana, light fruit, and some mild grain come together to present a final package that lacks coherence. Medium body with good carbonation. Okay, but not something Id look for again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 03-31-2011

Légèrement voilée, dune belle couleur miel doré sous un col blanc et mousseux.  Des odeurs de conifères et dalcool, puis de poivre, de pamplemousse et même de pêches!  Très amère.  Un corps moyen, mais une texture un peu raboteuse, avec une effervescence vive et une longue fin amère.

Le liquide voilé a une robe orangée.  La mousse forme un anneau chétif.  Le nez permet de découvrir des épices qui prennent avantage sur les maltés sucrés.  Des parfums de fruits tropicaux se font sentir : les pêches mûres et les pommes embaument latmosphère.  Lalcool pique les narines et contribue au rehaussement des épices.  Les houblons sont en fleurs et en herbes.  Au goût,  les saveurs épicées et les saveurs fruitées rejoignent un alcool bien parfumé.  Le malt est tout aussi doux et à sa place, un support à lintensité assez juste.  Des fleurs chatouillent les papilles.  En bouche, le liquide a une belle structure et une belle texture : assez légère, douce et soutenue par une bonne densité de bulles.  La finale est épicée, mordante et chaude dune amertume dalcool et de houblons.

Sampled on tap at Mondiale 2010.  Its hazy creamsicle orange with a ring of head.  Its got a grand cru-like orange peel , spice and yeast thing going on in the aroma.  The flavour is a little different, with some honey sweetness, but not too sweet, added to the citrus and spice.  A touch of hops as well.  Very nicely constructed.
Keg.  Complex spicyness, sweet with caramel and toffee, like a liquor.  Hides high alcohol well, very smooth.
@Jimmack Invitationalpours a thin off white head and gold color.  Aroma is mild yeast, medium malt.  Taste is yeast, medium malt, some earthy hops.  Good effervescence.

Bottle shared at the jimmack Invitational 10. Poured a slightly hazy honey gold body with a fomay white head. Sweet aroma with notes of caramel, honey, yeast and flowers. Average mouthfeel with srong carbonation. Flavors of flowers, honey, yeast, perfume and bread. Really nice sweet triple.

Draught Moose & Mountie Spectapular, Sydney.
Particularly potent golden ale. Lively carbonation is creamy on the palate, noticable booze very early on. Packed full of ripe apricots and cereal malts with supporting peppery spice. Long palate, deceptively easy to drink despite the alcohol being noticable.
Bottle at Jimmacks. Pours clear amber. Nose and taste of caramel malts, brown sugar, cane sugar, honey and light molasses.
tap at taphouse. very nice tripel. pours an amber colour with a generous head. quite sweet with a bready/caramel malt presence.
Tap. Exceptional beer. Aromas of caramel, toffee, and bread. Taste is sweet and spicy, very long lasting. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Cloudy yellow, with a frothy white head.

On tap at Vermont Brewfest 2010. Golden pour, good sized Head. Aroma is marked by citrus, fruity esters, yeast, and grain. Flavor is comparable, with a more fruit and yeast character balancing nicely. Mouthfeel really makes this beer- exceptionally clean and easy to drink. Very solid tripel.

Pours a hazy light orange with a thin, off-white head. Excellent lacing. Aroma is very spicy, full of baked cinnamon apples, potpourri, dried hops, cloves. Taste is spicy hops, red apples, fairly heavy fruitiness, citrus rinds. Heavy bitterness hides the 10% very well. Really liked this.

On draft. Color is golden with a big white head. Flavor is sweet with notes of fruit. Hides the alcohol incredibly well, and very well balanced between sweet, dry, and fruity. This is what I want in a Tripel.

On tap at Trou du Diable. Beautiful golden color with white lasting head. Aroma is quite discrete: floral, ester, cereal and some tropical fruits. Pretty alcoolic feel with citrus, cereal and pepper notes. Full bodied trippel with average carbonation and a nice bitter finish. Not so enjoyable  but complex and interesting brew. I prefer the oak-aged version.

Sample, offered by the brewer, tasted at the same time as La Buteuse aged in oak barrel containing brandy, Mondial de la bière, savoured on June 4 2009; eye: amber, no effervescence, no head, clear; nose: Brettanomyces yeast, light hops, alcohol, light pepper, light alcohol warmth, finale in Brettanomyces with presence of malt, light astringency, not much carbonation, nice bitterness, full body; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, offert par le brasseur, bue en parallèle avec La Buteuse vieillie en fût de chêne contenant du brandy, Mondial de la bière, 4 juin 2009; oeil : ambrée, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, claire; nez : levure Brettanomyces, léger houblon, alcool, léger poivre, quelque chose rappelant le savon mais dune agréable façon; bouche : levure Brettanomyces, léger houblon, alcool, poivre, légère chaleur dalcool, finale en Brettanomyces avec présence de malt, légère astringence, peu carbonatée, bonne amertume, corsée; en résumé : bien bon

On tap at Mascouche Oktoberfest. I was pleasantly surprise with the beer I tried at this event. Orange color and foamy head. Nice agrume and peach flavors. Nice bitterness, and alcohol was well hidden. Where can I find them in bottle !

On tap at Mascouche Oktoberfest, the brewer insisted that I try; he seemed pretty proud of this beer and with good reasons.  Delightful unboozy-feel tripel, with many dimensions ranging from citrusy and spicy (coriander, pepper) to subtlely sweet maltiness and a pretty dry hoppy finish.  Very well done.

at Festival Bières et Saveurs 2009. Grapefruit cloudy body along with white lace. Taste is some sourness, and grapefruit. Its hoppy. Its a good drinking ale, with average mouthfeel. I wonder how it is in the bottle with brett and oak ageing.

On tap at the pub. Slightly hazy amber body with a thin white foamy head. Enjoyable malty/hoppy aroma with spicy, fruity, and grainy hints. Alcohol is very well hidden. Sharp hoppy taste that carries fruity notes. Ends with a nice, warming, bitter finish. Good Tripel.

[2217-20090605] Sample. Sweet orange sugar aroma has mild peach flower and mild bubblegum notes. Clear, bright orange body with the quick foamy white head. Fresh orange flesh hops flavour with a long sweet orange sugar finish. Medium body is bitter. Fresh and very good, also very foamy when poured.
(4T @ Mondial 2009; Montreal, QC)

2009-06-05. Golden orange body with a small white head. Interesting aroma changes with each visit. Wood, yeast, florals, touch of esters, more florals bring a perfume note with them this time. Flavour is very light, light bitterness throughout, various florals. Alcohol is sufficiently restrained to make me question whether or not they gave us the correct beer. Average to light palate suits the profile. Pretty decent. On tap at Mondial 2009, Montreal"Thats okay Im wearing an adult diaper." - Garthicus

En fut au mondiale. Dégusté avec french tickler, Agaguk et Grand Génie. Bière de couleur blonde claire avec un mince collet moyennement collant. Arôme dalcool, de petite bananes, citrouille, clou de girofle, malt, oranges, sel, sucre gomme baloune et épices. Gout de menthe et de gomme baloune.
Clear golden. Aroma is very fruity with candi sugar, malt and hops. Flavor is malt, rye, yeast, sugar hops and alcohol.
Sample side by side with the aged bottle version. The bottle won. Dark amber. Clean delicate aroma; alcohol and melon. Peppery delicate body. Alcohol warmth. A cloud of flavour envelopes the tongue.

Verre de 12 oz, au Pub Brouhaha. Arômes de levure épicée et de houblon. Robe dorée, légère mousse, peu effervescente pour le style. Belle texture veloutée provenant de la levure belge et de son alcool. Légère touche sucrée. Le houblon marque sa présence dans finale légèrement amère et alcoolisée. Une triple ayant une inspiration américaine ?

Sampled from a draught tulip at Vices et Versa on 9/29/07Medium amount of white head is staunchly held above a lightly-hazed, light peach-golden body.  Light lacing ensues.Tremendously interesting yeast here!  I dont know what they used or how they fermented it, but its full of lovely esters and strong phenols, without being tacky or dominant (ie. its not a banana/clove bomb, nor do the phenols over-dry the nose/flavor).  Gives the effect of it being spiced with a variety of things, though I highly doubt there are any spices in it.  Notes of light vanilla, ginger, white pepper, tangerine juice and a tasteful amount of nectarine/peach esters fill this vivid aroma, with soft, well-attenuated pale malt sugars lying gently behind.  Terrifically balanced and with no sign of alcohol or flaw, I dont see any way for the flavor to not be as good.And Im not disappointed as a tight carbonation spreads spicy esters and light hops all over the palate, only to further dust it with a layer of honey-vanilla-like maltiness and finally end on a snappy, citric-like acidity, with soft hints of bubble gum and juicy fruits to add complexity.  Light alcohol warmth helps mitigate the effect of the sweet malts/esters and all the while, a distinctly Belgian yeast presence is fresh and endearing, adding depth to the flavor and authenticity to the style.  Really nice stuff, not aggressive with the alcohol or perfuminess, nor with the yeast character, but neither is it mellow in any category.  Well attenuated, preventing any syrupiness that some tripels succumb to.  Fantastic!Looking at earlier ratings, perhaps the beer has continued to dry out, as I really wasnt put off by any sweetness that earlier raters mention.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2008 In short: Very very sweet Belgian Strong Ale.  So-so.
How: Tap at Vices & Versa
The look: Cloudy amber body with a very small off-white head
In long: First thing that stoke me about the beer is its sweetness, halfway between caramel and maple syrup.  Some residual sugar.  The beer is a bit too sweet for its own good imho.  Citrus hops on the nose but very herbal (green grass) in the taste.  Light fruity notes here and there but also a hint of fresh vegetable.  Alcohol remains rather well concealed behind the sweetness.  Certainly not the flavour profile Ive come to expect from a triple.  Probably my least favourite from this excellent brewpub so far.  Surfing the previous ratings its pretty obvious that everybody liked it except me.  Something wrong with me?  I dont think so, not anymore at least, I used to be schizophrenic but were ok now.

Sampled on tap at the brewpub, keg was aged 10 months. 

Great looking golden brew with slightly amber reflections, with a ring of pearly white lace.

Spicy and sweet, bitter orange peel and lightly hopped, finished off with a bit of madeira/port.

Quite a sweet first attack, it hits you like maple taffee or hard sugar candy, it then takes on a more boozy, citrusy flavor.  The complex sugars give it plenty of backbone, as they linger on your palate long after each sip, but it did get a little cloying near the end, not exactly something I look for in the style.  I still liked it, but it could have used a little more time to mature and round out the sweetness.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2014 Any first impressions?
-A voluminous ring of foam circles the clear peach golden.
-An idiosyncratic banana crumbler aroma proffers much merriment.
-Multiple apples and pineapples lend their honeyed sweetness to the bready yeast and bulky cereal.
-An ample mouthfeel and rich texture benefit from the soft fluffy effervescence.

What if you dig deeper?
-I cannot recall the last time cereals came out so evidently when the body structure was so healthy.
-Alcohol is warming, but never aggressive.
-The yeast has worked overtime in this, loads of esters are developed, yet they dont feel strained.
-Decidedly, this apple crumbler of tripels is full of personality, and will please most Belgian lovers with a sweet tooth.
-A much younger tasting proved to be very hoppy and thus less fruity from the yeast. This batch appeared to have been drier as well, but that might have been an illusion from the increased hop presence throughout. I must say I preferred this freshness to the sweeter creature it usually is.
-The bottled version benefits from perfect conditioning. Appearance and mouthfeel are stellar.

On tap at the brewpub and from bottles.

Light caramel colored, gentle white head shows good persistence for this strenght level. Yeasty and heady nose comprises a solid dose of banana esters paired with sweet herbal candied maple components. Grows a certain mintiness through its spicy back-profile, yet the hops fail to kick in, leaving comfortable alcoholic warmth and floral sweet residual sugar finish the experience with lots of lenght. Medium-full bodied, moderate carbonation fits the flavor profile. Very very sweet, but their yeast does the job in rendering enough intricacies to keep the interest and complexity up with its floral, pepper, herbal undertones.
